title: Why are all capital letters inappropriate in emails? - Quora

response.answer_text: Why are all capital letters inappropriate in emails? Oh, they are absolutely appropriate—if you want the recipent to infer you are yelling at him or her. Like it or not, nowadays using all capital letters means you are shouting. We don’t have to agree with it, but it would be foolish to fly in the face of today’s common usage rule, especially this one. Furthermore, I feel it also implies the writer is too lazy to use the shift key, and, therefore, the reader isn’t important enough to warrant use of this simple common courtesy.

They're not. They are entirely appropriate. An email is a letter like any other- it just happens to be sent electronically. You would use capital letters as you use them anywhere else: for example, the beginning of sentences, for acronyms and names. Why would you think they wouldn't be used in an email?? NB: I have answered the question as it is written. To get the meaning other people have understood from this, the question would be: “Is it wrong to write an email entirely in Upper Case?” Or “Why is it wrong to write an email entirely in capital letters?”
